descriptions: Adaptive Card schema generated on 10/21/2025, 9:39 PM UTC. Includes features available in Teams, Copilot, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

id.description: A unique identifier for the element or action. Input elements must have an id, otherwise they will not be validated and their values will not be sent to the Bot.

requires.description: A list of capabilities the element requires the host application to support. If the host application doesn't support at least one of the listed capabilities, the element is not rendered (or its fallback is rendered if provided).

lang.description: The locale associated with the element.

isSortKey.description: Controls whether the element should be used as a sort key by elements that allow sorting across a collection of elements.

selectAction.description: An Action that will be invoked when the element is tapped or clicked. Action.ShowCard is not supported.

style.description: The style of the container. Container styles control the colors of the background, border and text inside the container, in such a way that contrast requirements are always met.

layouts.description: The layouts associated with the container. The container can dynamically switch from one layout to another as the card's width changes. See [Container layouts](topic:container-layouts) for more details.

minHeight.description: The minimum height, in pixels, of the container, in the `<number>px` format.

verticalContentAlignment.description: Controls how the container's content should be vertically aligned.

rtl.description: Controls if the content of the card is to be rendered left-to-right or right-to-left.

$schema.description: A URL to the Adaptive Card schema the card is authored against.

version.description: The Adaptive Card schema version the card is authored against.

fallbackText.description: The text that should be displayed if the client is not able to render the card.

speak.description: The text that should be spoken for the entire card.

refresh.description: Defines how the card can be refreshed by making a request to the target Bot.

authentication.description: Defines authentication information to enable on-behalf-of single-sign-on or just-in-time OAuth. This information is used in conjunction with the refresh property and Action.Execute in general.

msteams.description: Teams-specific metadata associated with the card.

grid.area.description: The area of a Layout.AreaGrid layout in which an element should be displayed.

fallback.description: An alternate element to render if the type of this one is unsupported or if the host application doesn't support all the capabilities specified in the requires property.

body.description: The body of the card, comprised of a list of elements displayed according to the layouts property. If the layouts property is not specified, a Layout.Stack is used.

actions.description: The card level actions, which always appear at the bottom of the card.

id.description: A unique identifier for the element or action. Input elements must have an id, otherwise they will not be validated and their values will not be sent to the Bot.

requires.description: A list of capabilities the element requires the host application to support. If the host application doesn't support at least one of the listed capabilities, the element is not rendered (or its fallback is rendered if provided).

title.description: The title of the action, as it appears on buttons.

iconUrl.description:
A URL (or Base64-encoded Data URI) to a PNG, GIF, JPEG or SVG image to be displayed on the left of the action's title.

`iconUrl` also accepts the `<icon-name>[,regular|filled]` format to display an icon from the vast [Adaptive Card icon catalog](topic:icon-catalog) instead of an image.

style.description: Control the style of the action, affecting its visual and spoken representations.

mode.description: Controls if the action is primary or secondary. Secondary actions appear in an overflow menu.

tooltip.description: The tooltip text to display when the action is hovered over.

isEnabled.description: Controls the enabled state of the action. A disabled action cannot be clicked. If the action is represented as a button, the button's style will reflect this state.

data.description: The data to send to the Bot when the action is executed. When expressed as an object, `data` is sent back to the Bot when the action is executed, adorned with the values of the inputs expressed as key/value pairs, where the key is the Id of the input. If `data` is expressed as a string, input values are not sent to the Bot.

associatedInputs.description: The Ids of the inputs associated with the Action.Submit. When the action is executed, the values of the associated inputs are sent to the Bot. See [Input validation](topic:input-validation) for more details.

conditionallyEnabled.description: Controls if the action is enabled only if at least one required input has been filled by the user.

fallback.description: An alternate action to render if the type of this one is unsupported or if the host application doesn't support all the capabilities specified in the requires property.

msteams.description: Defines the optional Teams-specific portion of the action's data.

value.description: The value that will be sent to the Bot.
The object to send to the Bot with the Invoke request.

text.description: The text that will be sent to the Bot.

displayText.description: The optional text that will be displayed as a new message in the conversation, as if the end-user sent it. `displayText` is not sent to the Bot.

value.description: Optional additional value that will be sent to the Bot. For instance, `value` can encode specific context for the action, such as unique identifiers or a JSON object.
The URL to redirect the end-user for signing in.

horizontalItemsAlignment.description: Controls how the content of the container should be horizontally aligned.

verticalItemsAlignment.description: Controls how the content of the container should be vertically aligned.

itemFit.description: Controls how item should fit inside the container.

minItemWidth.description: The minimum width, in pixels, of each item, in the `<number>px` format. Should not be used if itemWidth is set.

maxItemWidth.description: The maximum width, in pixels, of each item, in the `<number>px` format. Should not be used if itemWidth is set.

itemWidth.description: The width, in pixels, of each item, in the `<number>px` format. Should not be used if maxItemWidth and/or minItemWidth are set.

rowSpacing.description: The space between rows of items.

targetWidth.description: Controls for which card width the layout should be used.

columns.description: The columns in the grid layout, defined as a percentage of the available width or in pixels using the `<number>px` format.

areas.description: The areas in the grid layout.

name.description: The name of the area. To place an element in this area, set its `grid.area` property to match the name of the area.

column.description: The start column index of the area. Column indices start at 1.

columnSpan.description: Defines how many columns the area should span.

row.description: The start row index of the area. Row indices start at 1.

rowSpan.description: Defines how many rows the area should span.

url.description: The URL (or Base64-encoded Data URI) of the image. Acceptable formats are PNG, JPEG, GIF and SVG.

fillMode.description: Controls how the image should fill the area.

horizontalAlignment.description: Controls how the image should be aligned if it must be cropped or if using repeat fill mode.

verticalAlignment.description: Controls how the image should be aligned if it must be cropped or if using repeat fill mode.

action.description: The Action.Execute action to invoke to refresh the card.

userIds.description: The list of user Ids for which the card will be automatically refreshed. In Teams, in chats or channels with more than 60 users, the card will automatically refresh only for users specified in the userIds list. Other users will have to manually click on a "refresh" button. In contexts with fewer than 60 users, the card will automatically refresh for all users.

text.description: The text that can be displayed to the end user when prompting them to authenticate.

connectionName.description: The identifier for registered OAuth connection setting information.

buttons.description: The buttons that should be displayed to the user when prompting for authentication. The array MUST contain one button of type “signin”. Other button types are not currently supported.

tokenExchangeResource.description: Provides information required to enable on-behalf-of single sign-on user authentication.

image.description: A URL to an image to display alongside the button’s caption.

value.description: The value associated with the button. The meaning of value depends on the button’s type.

id.description: The unique identified of this token exchange instance.

uri.description: An application ID or resource identifier with which to exchange a token on behalf of. This property is identity provider- and application-specific.

providerId.description: An identifier for the identity provider with which to attempt a token exchange.

width.description:
Controls the width of the card in a Teams chat.

Note that setting `width` to "full" will not actually stretch the card to the "full width" of the chat pane. It will only make the card wider than when the `width` property isn't set.

entities.description: The Teams-specific entities associated with the card.

text.description: The text that will be substituted with the mention.

id.description: The Id of a person (typically a Microsoft Entra user Id) or tag.

name.description: The name of the mentioned entity.

mentionType.description: The type of the mentioned entity.

webUrl.description: The URL the card originates from. When `webUrl` is set, the card is dubbed an **Adaptive Card-based Loop Component** and, when pasted in Teams or other Loop Component-capable host applications, the URL will unfurl to the same exact card.

id.description: A unique identifier for the element or action. Input elements must have an id, otherwise they will not be validated and their values will not be sent to the Bot.

requires.description: A list of capabilities the element requires the host application to support. If the host application doesn't support at least one of the listed capabilities, the element is not rendered (or its fallback is rendered if provided).

lang.description: The locale associated with the element.

isVisible.description: Controls the visibility of the element.

separator.description: Controls whether a separator line should be displayed above the element to visually separate it from the previous element. No separator will be displayed for the first element in a container, even if this property is set to true.

height.description: The height of the element. When set to stretch, the element will use the remaining vertical space in its container.

horizontalAlignment.description: Controls how the element should be horizontally aligned.

spacing.description: Controls the amount of space between this element and the previous one. No space will be added for the first element in a container.

targetWidth.description: Controls for which card width the element should be displayed. If targetWidth isn't specified, the element is rendered at all card widths. Using targetWidth makes it possible to author responsive cards that adapt their layout to the available horizontal space. For more details, see [Responsive layout](topic:responsive-layout).

isSortKey.description: Controls whether the element should be used as a sort key by elements that allow sorting across a collection of elements.

selectAction.description: An Action that will be invoked when the element is tapped or clicked. Action.ShowCard is not supported.

style.description: The style of the container. Container styles control the colors of the background, border and text inside the container, in such a way that contrast requirements are always met.

showBorder.description: Controls if a border should be displayed around the container.

roundedCorners.description: Controls if the container should have rounded corners.

layouts.description: The layouts associated with the container. The container can dynamically switch from one layout to another as the card's width changes. See [Container layouts](topic:container-layouts) for more details.

bleed.description: Controls if the container should bleed into its parent. A bleeding container extends into its parent's padding.

minHeight.description: The minimum height, in pixels, of the container, in the `<number>px` format.

verticalContentAlignment.description: Controls how the container's content should be vertically aligned.

rtl.description: Controls if the content of the card is to be rendered left-to-right or right-to-left.

maxHeight.description: The maximum height, in pixels, of the container, in the `<number>px` format. When the content of a container exceeds the container's maximum height, a vertical scrollbar is displayed.

lang.description: The locale associated with the element.

isVisible.description: Controls the visibility of the element.

separator.description: Controls whether a separator line should be displayed above the element to visually separate it from the previous element. No separator will be displayed for the first element in a container, even if this property is set to true.

height.description: The height of the element. When set to stretch, the element will use the remaining vertical space in its container.

horizontalAlignment.description: Controls how the element should be horizontally aligned.

spacing.description: Controls the amount of space between this element and the previous one. No space will be added for the first element in a container.

targetWidth.description: Controls for which card width the element should be displayed. If targetWidth isn't specified, the element is rendered at all card widths. Using targetWidth makes it possible to author responsive cards that adapt their layout to the available horizontal space. For more details, see [Responsive layout](topic:responsive-layout).

isSortKey.description: Controls whether the element should be used as a sort key by elements that allow sorting across a collection of elements.

text.description: The text to display. A subset of markdown is supported.

isSubtle.description: Controls whether the text should be renderer using a subtler variant of the select color.

fontType.description: The type of font to use for rendering.

wrap.description: Controls if the text should wrap.

maxLines.description: The maximum number of lines to display.

style.description: The style of the text.

x.description:
The x axis value of the data point.

If all x values of the x [Chart.Line](topic:Chart.Line) are expressed as a number, or if all x values are expressed as a date string in the `YYYY-MM-DD` format, the chart will be rendered as a time series chart, i.e. x axis values will span across the minimum x value to maximum x value range.

Otherwise, if x values are represented as a mix of numbers and strings or if at least one x value isn't in the `YYYY-MM-DD` format, the chart will be rendered as a categorical chart, i.e. x axis values will be displayed as categories.

requires.description: A list of capabilities the element requires the host application to support. If the host application doesn't support at least one of the listed capabilities, the element is not rendered (or its fallback is rendered if provided).

lang.description: The locale associated with the element.

isVisible.description: Controls the visibility of the element.

height.description: The height of the element. When set to stretch, the element will use the remaining vertical space in its container.

targetWidth.description: Controls for which card width the element should be displayed. If targetWidth isn't specified, the element is rendered at all card widths. Using targetWidth makes it possible to author responsive cards that adapt their layout to the available horizontal space. For more details, see [Responsive layout](topic:responsive-layout).

isSortKey.description: Controls whether the element should be used as a sort key by elements that allow sorting across a collection of elements.

selectAction.description: An Action that will be invoked when the element is tapped or clicked. Action.ShowCard is not supported.

style.description: The style of the container. Container styles control the colors of the background, border and text inside the container, in such a way that contrast requirements are always met.

showBorder.description: Controls if a border should be displayed around the container.

roundedCorners.description: Controls if the container should have rounded corners.

layouts.description: The layouts associated with the container. The container can dynamically switch from one layout to another as the card's width changes. See [Container layouts](topic:container-layouts) for more details.

minHeight.description: The minimum height, in pixels, of the container, in the `<number>px` format.

verticalContentAlignment.description: Controls how the container's content should be vertically aligned.

rtl.description: Controls if the content of the card is to be rendered left-to-right or right-to-left.

maxHeight.description: The maximum height, in pixels, of the container, in the `<number>px` format. When the content of a container exceeds the container's maximum height, a vertical scrollbar is displayed.

grid.area.description: The area of a Layout.AreaGrid layout in which an element should be displayed.

fallback.description: An alternate element to render if the type of this one is unsupported or if the host application doesn't support all the capabilities specified in the requires property.
